intro: Succisa pratensis var. subacaulis, commonly known as the slender meadow cranesbill, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe. It typically reaches a height of around 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces pink or purple flowers in terminal clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable component of biodiversity-rich habitats.
